com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring

Enum MonitoringManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<MonitoringManager>
      • com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.MonitoringManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<MonitoringManager>

    public enum MonitoringManager
extends java.lang.Enum<MonitoringManager>
    Allows to scan PowerMote beacons in Activity and Service. You have only one instance of this class, and you gets it using the MonitoringManager.INSTANCE.

    This class is really just a wrapper for a BeaconScanService and used to interact with the scan service. Usage: 

    {@code
  //Set scan listener
  MonitoringManager.INSTANCE.setScanListener(new ScanListener() {
    Since:
    1.0.0
    See Also:
    BackgroundManager

      Scan using the highest duty cycle.

      Perform Bluetooth LE scan in the low power mode.

        public static final MonitoringManager INSTANCE

    • Field Detail

      • SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER

        public static final int SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER
        Perform Bluetooth LE scan in the low power mode. This is the default scan mode as it consumes the lowest power.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCAN_MODE_BALANCED

        public static final int SCAN_MODE_BALANCED
        Perform Bluetooth LE scan in the balanced power mode. Scan results are returned at a rate that provides a good trade-off between scan frequency and power consumption.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY

        public static final int SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY
        Scan using the highest duty cycle. It's recommended to only use this mode when the application is running in the foreground.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setScanMode

        public void setScanMode(int scanMode)
        Set scan mode for Bluetooth LE scan. For devices running on Android OS with version lower than Lollipop this parameter does not affect scan performance.
        Parameters:
        scanMode - The scan mode can be one of SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER, SCAN_MODE_BALANCED or SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY.

      • isBackgroundMode

        public boolean isBackgroundMode()
        Returns whether the scan service is in the background mode.
        Returns:
        true if connection is successfully established with the scan service
        See Also:
        bind(Context, com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.listeners.ServiceConnectionListener)

      • setBackgroundMode

        public void setBackgroundMode(boolean backgroundMode)
        Changes the scan service mode between foreground and background.
        Parameters:
        backgroundMode - Scan service mode

      • addMonitoringRegion

        public void addMonitoringRegion(Region region)
        Starts monitoring for a given region. Results will be delivered to the listener registered using setMonitoringListener(com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.listeners.MonitoringListener).

        If the region is already monitored, then it is ignored. You can monitor multiple regions at the same time. Listener will be called for each region separately.

        Parameters:
        region - Region to monitor

      • removeMonitoringRegion

        public void removeMonitoringRegion(Region region)
        Stops ranging for a given region.
        Parameters:
        region - Region that was ranged
        See Also:
        addRangingRegion(com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.info.Region)

      • addRangingRegion

        public void addRangingRegion(Region region)
        Starts ranging for a given region. Results will be delivered to the listener registered using setRangingListener(com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.listeners.RangingListener).

        If the region is already ranged, then it is ignored. You can range multiple regions at the same time. Listener will be called for each region separately.

        Parameters:
        region - Region to range

      • removeRangingRegion

        public void removeRangingRegion(Region region)
        Stops monitoring for a given region.
        Parameters:
        region - Region that was monitored
        See Also:
        addMonitoringRegion(com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.info.Region)
